intro: Fridericia trailii, commonly known as the trailing fridericia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, showy yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a velvety texture. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and blooms.
